names.english: wei ling decoction for eliminating dampness
names.commonEnglish: Eliminate Dampness Decoction by Combining Calm the Stomach Powder with Five Ingredient Powder with Poria
aka: Wei Ling Decoction for Eliminating Dampness

actions: Strongly dries Dampness, tonifies the Spleen and clears Dampness from the Lower Jiao.
With Hou Po, for Dampness obstructing Spleen Yang.
With Hou Po and Chen Pi, for Dampness Obstructing the Middle Jiao.
Promotes the movement of Qi in the Middle Jiao and resolves Stagnation, descends Qi,dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Zhi Shi, for Stagnant Qi failing to move.
With Zhi Shi and Bai Zhu, due to epigastric and abdominal distention due to Qi and Food Stagnation.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, relieves the diaphragm, Dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Hou Po and Cang Zhu, for Damp-Cold stagnating the Spleen and Stomach.
With Bai Zhu, for Damp Obstruction due to Spleen Deficiency.
With Bai Zhu and Fang Feng, for borborygmus, abdominal pain, and diarrhea due to Liver Attacking the Spleen.
With Cang Zhu and Chi Fu Ling, for a thick white tongue coat with no desire to drink.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and dispels Damp-Heat.
Promotes urination and leaches out Dampness.
With Bai Zhu, for Spleen Deficiency leading to accumulation of Dampness.
With Chi Fu Ling, facilitates the removal of water and leaches out Dampness.
With Zhu Ling and Fu Ling for generalized edema.
Clears Dampness and Heat.
With Zhu Ling, promotes urination.
With Ze Xie and Zhu Ling, facilitates the removal of water and leaches out Dampness.
With Bai Zhu, strengthens the Spleen and resolves Dampness.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
With Zhi Shi, for Spleen Deficiency with Qi Stagnation.
With Zhu Ling and Ze Xie, for edema due to Internal Dampness.
With Chi Fu Ling and Gan Cao, for Spleen and Stomach Qi Deficiency.
Promotes urination and expels Damp-Heat.
Expels Wind-Dampness and alleviates pain.
With Cang Zhu, for pain due to Wind-Dampness Bi.
Breaks up Stagnant Qi, reduces accumulation, descends Qi, transforms Phlegm and reduces distention.
With Chen Pi, strengthens the Middle Jiao.
Promotes urination.
Warms the Kidneys, Spleen and Heart, strengthens the Yang and Ming Men Fire, warms and unblocks the channels and vessels and alleviates pain.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness.
With Hua Shi, for Damp-Heat in the Heart, Lung, and Urinary Bladder channels.
With Mu Tong, for Damp-Heat lodging in the Lower Jiao.
Clears Heat
Dries Dampness in the Lower Jiao
Eliminates toxins
Regulates Qi
Harmonizes the Middle Jiao
Relieves swelling
syndromes: Damp-Heat Attacks the Skin - Dampness predominant

symptoms: Burning and painful vesicles on the waist, back, lower back, flanks

notes: This formula is usually used for herpes zoster that erupts in the mid to lower back region.
